title: Decision Making Under Time Pressure
content: Time pressure changes decision-making fundamentally. Analysis must compress. Information gathering truncates. Acceptable risk tolerance increases. The goal shifts from optimal decision to sufficient decision made in time. Prepare for time pressure by establishing decision rules and trigger points in advance.

mcq.question: You have 15 seconds to decide whether to abort a procedure. What's your best approach?

options.A: Quick mental review of all options
options.B: Apply pre-established decision criteria for abort conditions
options.D: Default to continuing unless something is clearly wrong

mcq.explanation: 15 seconds doesn't allow deliberation. Pre-established criteria let you assess against defined triggers rather than reasoning from scratch under pressure.

openQuestions: What decisions in your role could require action in seconds?
What pre-established criteria do you have for those decisions?
